title: Magnesium glycinate vs citrate: whatâ€™s the difference?
excerpt: Both provide magnesium; glycinate is often gentler, citrate can be more laxative.
contentHtml:
Glycinate is often chosen for its gentler GI profile and evening use. Citrate is widely available and may be more laxative at higher doses. In both cases, check total elemental magnesium and split doses for tolerance.

  • Glycinate: commonly evening or with meals
  • Citrate: with meals; consider evening if laxative effects occur
